page.title: 03PUBLIC RECORD OFFICE, KEW
page.content:
Near Kew Bridge is the fine new{Public {Record Office,}which was opened in 1977. In this modern, well-equipped research centre, records of past and present{Government Departments}are stored. The records include those of the{Cabinet,}the{Treasury}(extending back to the 16th Century), the{Foreign and{Colonial Offices,}the{Admiralty (including the Navy Board), the{War {Office}and the{Copyright Office.}The records of the Colonial Office include Colonial State Papers from the 16th Century onwards.
The storage at Kew amounts to{360,000 linear feet, and Government records transferred by{September 1984}for permanent preservation have taken up {303,000}linear feet. At the present rate of usage, existing storage space will be fully taken up by{1995.
